Metz

Bonjour Ami! Welcome to “home base” where I will be taking classes during a semester abroad while traveling Europe. Metz (pronounced Mess) is a perfect mix of old fashion European architecture and modern technologies such as the versatile bus system running on the minute. The satelittle campus of Georgia Tech at which I am staying is known as Georgia Tech Lorraine (GTL) and

Orientation

First day orientation, setting the ground rules…

CESCOM

This is CESCOM, another building used by Georgia Tech Lorraine. This is the apartment complex I am staying at, known as Layfayette. Here is a distant view of Georgia Tech’s satelite campus, and the area I am living in.

Cathedral

It wouldn’t be a European city without a few massive cathedrals such as this one, at the center of the city.

Train Station

One of two major train stations in the city, Garé is closer to the southern region and has routes all across Europe.
